meanings.definition: An estimate based on a mixture of guesswork and calculation.
meanings.sent1: My guesstimates for the number of jellybeans in the jar are usually way off.
meanings.sent2: We had to rely on guesstimates to plan the party since we didn't have exact numbers.
meanings.sent3: I made guesstimates about how many cookies to bake, but now we have too many!
meanings.sent4: Her guesstimates about the weather are as accurate as a broken clock.
meanings.sent5: The detective's guesstimates were so precise, it was like he had a crystal ball.

meanings.definition: To make an estimate based on guesswork rather than precise calculation.
meanings.sent1: I always guesstimate the time it takes to walk to school.
meanings.sent2: When we don't have all the data, we have to guesstimate the project's cost.
meanings.sent3: She guesstimated the weight of the pumpkin by lifting it in her arms.
meanings.sent4: The coach had to guesstimate the players' speeds during the race.
meanings.sent5: He guesstimates the distance to the moon by looking at the night sky.
